1.brief: wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

2.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be (causatively, make) bitter (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to rebel (or resist; causatively, to provoke)
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

3.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
to braid, i.e. intermix; technically, to traffic (as if by barter); also or give to be security (as a kind of exchange)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to clatter, i.e. slap (the hands together), clang (an instrument); by analogy, to drive (a nail or tent-pin, a dart, etc.); by implication, to become bondsman by handclasping)

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

5.brief: properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)

6.brief: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

7.brief: to be weak, i.e. (figuratively) to despond (causatively, rebuke), or (of light, the eye) to grow dull
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

8.brief: to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

9.brief: to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to be pure (physical sound, clear, unadulterated; Levitically, uncontaminated; morally, innocent or holy)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)

10.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present

11.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a plan, especially a bad one
the heart (as the most interior organ);

12.brief: properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness

13.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
the dark; hence (literally) darkness; figuratively, misery, destruction, death, ignorance, sorrow, wickedness
to spread (a bed); by implication, to refresh
spread, i.e. a bed; (architecture) an extension, i.e. wing or lean-to (a single story or collectively)

14.brief: a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))
a sister (used very widely (like brother), literally and figuratively)
a maggot (as rapidly bred), literally or figuratively

15.brief: strictly a demonstrative particle, here; but used of time, now or then
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for

16.brief: properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
a descent, i.e. imposition, unfavorable (punishment) or favorable (food); restfulness
